biography.summary: Marsha W. Blackburn is a Republican U.S. Senator from Tennessee, serving since 2019. Prior to her Senate tenure, she served in the U.S. House of Representatives (2003â€“2019) representing Tennessee's 7th district.

contact.office_address: 357 Dirksen Senate Office Building Washington DC 20510

committees.name: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

policy_positions.stance: Supports free-market-based healthcare reforms and opposes single-payer systems

bills_sponsored.title: Secure the Border Act
bills_sponsored.summary: A bill to strengthen border security and enforcement across federal agencies.

bills_sponsored.title: Small Business Cybersecurity Act
bills_sponsored.summary: A bill to improve cybersecurity resources for small businesses.

recent_votes.bill: H.R. 1 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act

timeline.event: Elected to U.S. House of Representatives for Tennessee's 7th district.
Elected to the U.S. Senate; began term as Senator from Tennessee.
